data.title: Quick trip
data.text: They serve Mexican food in a grocery store.  It is ok and reasonable, but the atmosphere is very bland.  It is dated and very simple.  Just for someone looking for a quick meal.

data.title: Muy buen lugar para comer comida mexicana en Burnsville
data.text: Great place to eat Mexican food in Burnsville! Not fancy by any means but friendly and the food was delicious! At a good price too!

data.title: Nice food in a small place
data.text: We had to try this place after hearing about it from a friend and its not that great looking, but the food is definitely worth it.  The tacos, burritos and quesadillas are delicious and if you like spicy food try the salsa on your food or on the side.  We have to try the dinner for two the next time we are there and price wise it seems reasonable and better than Chipotle.

data.title: Small Business with Great Food!
data.text:
This place makes me weep for every burrito I have eaten at Chipotle...and I think Chipotle is just fine. I was running kids around the other night and we pulled in here to grab a quick dinner. My son had a carne asada burrito and my daughter had the carnitas tacos. I poached from both plates and wished I were hungrier. The burrito in particular was so delicious. The beef was seared perfectly, the queso blanco was generously distributed throughout and the rice was perfect both in flavor and quantity.

The atmosphere is bare bones basic in the most charming way possible. Something about it reminded me of the pork stores in the New Jersey neighborhood my husband grew up frequenting.  They have a few tables set up, some pastry cases, an ice cream cooler, boxes stacked all over, colorful signage. 

It was humble and they just focus on serving great food. Nicely done, guys.

data.title: Great Authentic Mexican Food
data.text:
We recently moved to Burnsville, MN and had to try this place.  Its nothing fancy on the inside, but the food is great.

We have been here multiple times and can say the tacos, burritos and quesadillas are delicious.  We can usually get a dinner for two for $15.

Beware the salsa will light you up, so make sure you know the heat levels before trying.
